docs.snippet: MIAMI, March 21 When Cuba decides to open its doors wider to American visitors, who now can travel there legally, it might have to cope with tens of thousands of visiting Cuban refugees....
docs.lead_paragraph: MIAMI, March 21 When Cuba decides to open its doors wider to American visitors, who now can travel there legally, it might have to cope with tens of thousands of visiting Cuban refugees.
docs.abstract: US State Dept and passport and immigration offices in Miami are deluged with inquiries from Cuban refugees about travel to Cuba; Treas Dept expected to announce end of ban on spending of US currency by Amers in Cuba, clearing way for start of tours; Antonio Alino, pres of Evisa Travel, Miami agent for Mexicana Airlines, says Cuban officials have given assurances that all visitors from US, including refugees, will be permitted to visit Cuba (S)

docs.snippet: PARIS--French authorities are splitting hairs these days over a distinction between the un  shaven clochards and the longhaired young men who are generically known as les beatniks. No one is bothering the clocharda, the Paris equivalent of New Yor...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS--French authorities are splitting hairs these days over a distinction between the un shaven clochards and the longhaired young men who are generically known as les beatniks. No one is bothering the clocharda, the Paris equivalent of New York's Bowery bums, but the out-of-bounds sign is being hoisted at strategic points for the jaded beatniks in the faded dungarees.

headline.main: CLOCHARDS AND BEATNIKS; Paris Tolerates Native Bums but Turns Cold Eye on Imports
